successStories.title: Success Stories
successStories.description: See how my mentoring helped other developers achieve their goals.

items.name: Felipe Carneiro
items.feedback: The mentoring helped me with the theoretical and practical basis of software development. Before, I studied independently, but with Lojhan's teaching, my learning and direction increased exponentially.

items.name: Fernando Lotti
items.feedback:
Man, mentoring with Lojhan was simply different from anything I had ever experienced. 
He has a gentle, calm manner that makes everything lighter — but at the same time super sharp and provocative (in a good way). During our conversations, he made me think about several points that I had never stopped to reflect on. We went from recommending reading material to sincere exchanges of experiences — where we got it right, where we got it wrong, what we learned from it. 
When I had technical questions, he never gave me the answer straight away. Instead, he encouraged me to experiment, to use a new tool, to get out of my comfort zone. Without a doubt, during the time he mentored me, I took a huge leap in my career. It was a real turning point.

items.name: Tiago Rodrigues
items.feedback:
The mentoring with Lojhan came at a time when I was still thinking about the direction of my career: whether to continue delving deeper into the technical area or to move towards a path more focused on technology management.
After a period working as a senior developer, natural doubts began to arise about the next step. Over time, my interest in IT management became clearer, and the mentoring was fundamental in this process of discovery and transition.
The conversations provided direction, broadened my vision of the role of a technical leader, and helped me understand in greater depth the responsibilities of roles such as software architect and tech lead — both from a technical and behavioral perspective. The exchange was even richer because it included real-world application examples, making the learning practical and applicable to everyday life.
I believe that maintaining this type of active mentoring is essential to support professionals who are in transition or seeking growth, especially those who want to position themselves more strategically within technical teams and take on leadership roles.

hero.title: Streamline Software Migration with
hero.description: A versatile library designed to facilitate the smooth update of critical software paths. Manage and execute synchronous, asynchronous, and promise-returning tests with ease.

features.title: Powerful Features
features.subtitle: Everything you need to manage complex testing workflows efficiently

items.title: Multiple Test Types
items.description: Support for synchronous, asynchronous, and promise-returning tests. Execute any type of experiment with confidence.

items.title: Configurable Options
items.description: Customize verbosity, logging, and behavior on performance changes. Fine-tune exactly how your experiments run.

items.title: Robust Error Handling
items.description: Comprehensive error handling with custom error types and continuation chains for reliable execution.

items.title: Validation Methods
items.description: Add custom validation methods to ensure your tests produce expected results.

api.title: API Reference
api.subtitle: Essential methods to work with Cientista

items.description: Add a test with optional cleanup and validation methods
Add a cleanup method to a test
Skip tests based on conditions, regex patterns, or arrays of names
Define callback for successful test executions
Define callback for error handling
Execute all registered tests with provided arguments

contact.title: Need Assistance Using Cientista?
contact.description: Get expert guidance on implementing Cientista in your project. I can help you set up experiments, optimize your testing workflows, and answer any questions you have.

hero.title: High-Performance Resource Management with
hero.description: A fast, efficient resource pool implementation built with Rust and N-API. Manage connections, threads, and expensive objects with native performance.

features.title: Powerful Features
features.subtitle: Everything you need for efficient resource management at scale

items.title: High Performance
items.description: Significant speed advantage over pure JavaScript implementations thanks to native Rust code.

items.title: Flexible Acquisition
items.description: Supports both synchronous blocking acquire() and asynchronous acquireAsync() with timeouts.

items.title: Automatic Cleanup
items.description: The use() pattern ensures resources are automatically released back to the pool, even if errors occur.

items.title: Real-time Observability
items.description: Monitor pool status with real-time properties: size, available resources, pending requests, and used count.

api.title: API Reference
api.subtitle: Essential methods to work with Resource Pool

items.description: Creates a pool pre-filled with the provided array of resources
Acquires a resource, executes fn, and automatically releases it
Returns a promise that resolves with a resource or rejects on timeout
Synchronously acquires a resource. Throws if none are available
Returns a resource to the pool, making it available for other consumers
Adds a new resource to the pool dynamically

contact.title: Need Help with Resource Pool?
contact.description: Get expert guidance on implementing Resource Pool in your project. I can help you optimize resource management, handle concurrency, and answer any questions.
